N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1157.8 - Actions involving Federal participation

State Regulations
(a) Where there has been duly prepared under
the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969, both a draft environmental
impact statement and a final environmental impact statement for a proposed
action, the authority shall have no obligation with respect to his Part except
that: (1)

The environmental impact statements
shall contain or be supplemented by a description of any growth-inducing
aspects of the proposed action and a discussion of the effects of the proposed
action on the use and conservation of energy, and
(2)

The authority shall make and file, in
accordance with section
1157.9
of this Part, the findings
required by section 8-0109, subdivision 8 of SEQR, except where the authority
did not participate in the preparation of the Federal environmental impact
statement, such Federal report shall be supplemented only by the items set
forth in paragraph (1) of this subdivision. (b) Where a written threshold determination
that the action will not require a Federal impact statement has been duly
prepared or a negative declaration has been duly prepared, pursuant to the

National Environmental Policy Act of 1969, the authority shall have no
obligation with respect to this Part provided the authority, pursuant to the
provisions of subdivision (b) of section
1157.5
of this Part, makes a
determination that the proposed action will not have a significant effect on
the environment and files a copy of, and gives public notice of such
determination. Notes
